column4: hello... I'm have the following problem: my generic kernel (or my old 686 kernel I used in dapper) doesn't boot
I am using a 386 kernel at the moment
what sort of issues are you having?
What problems are you having exactly?
also make sure you have the ubuntu-desktop meta package.
I think this is not a problem with usplash... it seems as if the hd wasn't accesible when trying to boot a generic (since 386 finds the splash and the archive mdadm.conf)
the only logs I have are those from the 386 boots... the generic boots didn't get logged
by the way... if I use recovery mode the system stops at "Waiting for root filesystem"
